The final shape has symmetrical dimensions around the center of the object.*</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Hollow Center** The first part of the CAD model is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a hollow center. The shape is created by first drawing a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system, then transforming the sketch into 3D using extrusion. **Step 1: Define the coordinate system** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.1493, 0.0] **Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch** Draw the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face, face_1, which contains the following loop: - loop_1 - line_1: [0.0, 0.1176] to [0.1281, 0.0] - line_2: [0.1281, 0.0] to [0.5288, 0.0] - line_3: [0.5288, 0.0] to [0.6584, 0.1413] - line_4: [0.6584, 0.1413] to [0.6584, 0.75] - line_5: [0.6584, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] - line_6: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.1176] This loop forms a rectangle with a triangular notch cut out of the top left corner. **Step 3: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 and transform it into 3D using extrusion. The extrusion properties are as follows: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1493 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0 **Step 4: Combine with previous parts** The boolean operation for this part with the previous parts is to create a new solid body. The dimensions of the part are: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.1493 - Height: 0.75</description>
